LME CEO aims to have first contracts with Shanghai futures exchange in 2024The London Metal Exchange (LME) aims to have pilot contracts using prices from the Shanghai Futures Exchange (ShFE) this year, its chief executive told Reuters on the sidelines of the World Economic Forum (WEF) annual meeting. Thu, 18 Jan 2024 09:48:07 GMT 5I2U27QF5JLAZH7Q4YSKDNFIDM https://www.reuters.com/markets/commodities/lme-ceo-aims-have-first-contracts-with-shanghai-futures-exchange-2024-2024-01-18/Divya Chowdhury, Savio Shetty市场商品
Exclusive: India could ease China investment curbs if border stays calmIndia could ease its heightened scrutiny of Chinese investments if the two countries' border remains peaceful, a senior Indian official said in the first signal that the four-year-old curbs could be lifted. Thu, 18 Jan 2024 08:12:16 GMT 22LDOBSUMJJTXMJYS7OEHID234 https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/india-could-ease-china-investment-curbs-if-border-stays-calm-2024-01-18/Una Galani,, Peter Thal Larsen商业达沃斯
Luxury group Richemont's sales jump in China while Europe slipsCartier jewellery owner Richemont painted a mixed picture of the luxury sector in its latest results on Thursday, reporting a sales decline in Europe but a big increase in China. House committee raises doubts about US Navy's Indo-Pacific logisticsA U.S. congressional committee on China has sent a letter to the Secretary of the Navy raising doubts about a plan to move fuel from Hawaii to storage facilities across the Indo-Pacific and warning that the U.S. military risks being unprepared for a possible conflict. Thu, 18 Jan 2024 06:05:40 GMT 3JDQ4NBWF5NFXGJYNBBX5EJPTY https://www.reuters.com/world/us/house-committee-raises-doubts-about-us-navys-indo-pacific-logistics-2024-01-18/Michael Martina世界美国
TSMC bullish on AI demand, forecasts 20% revenue growth this yearTaiwanese chipmaker TSMC projected on Thursday more than 20% growth in 2024 revenue on booming demand for high-end chips used in artificial intelligence (AI) applications even as the broader industry deals with weak smartphone and electric vehicle sales. Thu, 18 Jan 2024 05:38:57 GMT DN3UF74LLBNONE2XLVGDZ7TYBM https://www.reuters.com/technology/tsmc-q4-profit-falls-19-beats-market-expectations-2024-01-18/Yimou Lee, Faith Hung技术
British Airways to double Mandarin-speaking cabin crew on China routesBritish Airways will double the number of Mandarin-speaking cabin crew on its China routes, its chief customer officer said on Thursday, as the airline seeks to expand in the world's second-largest aviation market. Thu, 18 Jan 2024 05:30:25 GMT 724XCNKG6JLQ3D5VU37XANB36E https://www.reuters.com/business/aerospace-defense/british-airways-double-mandarin-speaking-cabin-crew-china-routes-2024-01-18/Joe Cash, Sophie Yu商业航空航天与国防
Taiwan's remaining Pacific allies pledge supportTaiwan's remaining Pacific Island allies have pledged support in the wake of Nauru cutting ties on Monday days after a presidential election, a move that whittled Taiwan's diplomatic footprint in the region to three countries. Thu, 18 Jan 2024 04:42:23 GMT I6S6UHRAPVLO5MF4JNWT3E5F2I https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/taiwan-remaining-pacific-allies-pledge-support-2024-01-18/Reuters世界亚太地区
Sinopec, BP agree to stronger cooperation in fuel sales, tradingBP and Chinese state oil major Sinopec signed a memorandum of understanding at the World Economic Forum in Davos to strengthen cooperation in areas including fuel sales, oil and gas trading, and upstream activities, according to a post on Sinopec's Weibo account on Thursday. Japan counts down to precision 'moon sniper' landing missionJapan aims to become the fifth country to put a spacecraft on the moon when it attempts a precision landing on Friday, in what would be a boost for a space program eclipsed by rival China. Taiwan to keep cabinet in place after customary post-election resignationTaiwan President Tsai Ing-wen on Thursday asked the ministerial cabinet led by Premier Chen Chien-jen to stay on and ensure a smooth handover after it submitted its customary post-election joint resignation. Why are there concerns about China's pension system as its population ages?China's ageing population threatens key Beijing policy goals for the coming decade of boosting domestic consumption and reining in ballooning debt, posing a severe challenge to the economy's long-term growth prospects.
